body_html: @apaszke I have changed the way @script_method works. Now the stub does not have attributes like __doc__. Because @script_method always works together with ScriptModule, whether a stub's __doc__ is set correctly is not really important since the stubs will be deleted in ScriptMeta.__init__. More importantly, it is much more important that the thing returned by ScriptModule.__getattr__ have these wrap attributes set correctly, so I create wrappers for them.

Because @script_method always works together with ScriptModule, whether a stub's __doc__ is set correctly is not really important since the stubs will be deleted in ScriptMeta.__init__. More importantly, it is much more important that the thing returned by ScriptModule.__getattr__ have these wrap attributes set correctly, so I create wrappers for them.
body: @apaszke I have changed the way `@script_method` works. Now the stub does not have attributes like `__doc__`. Because `@script_method` always works together with `ScriptModule`, whether a stub's `__doc__` is set correctly is not really important since the stubs will be deleted in `ScriptMeta.__init__`. More importantly, it is much more important that the thing returned by `ScriptModule.__getattr__` have these wrap attributes set correctly, so I create wrappers for them.
